intro: Coccothrinax microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf palm or small-leaf palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Bahamas and the Greater Antilles. This palm is characterized by its compact stature, with short, clustered leaves and a slender trunk. The plant thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils. Its small, clustered leaves and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for landscaping in tropical regions.
